en: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s elect, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,
hmr: Paula Pathien suok, Pathien ithlanghai ringna kawnga le, Pathien ngaisak tieng thutak hrietna kawnga Isu Krista tirko bawk chun:

en: in hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised before times eternal;
hmr: Chatuona hringna beiseina chu Pathien khêl hril thei naw chun leilung insieng hmain a tiem a;

en: but in his own seasons manifested his word in the message, wherewith I was intrusted according to the commandment of God our Saviour;
hmr: nisienlakhawm, ama hun taka- hai chun a thu chu thuinchaa chun a suklang tah a, chu thuincha chu Pathien ei Sandamtu thupêk ang peia inkawltir ka nih.

en: to Titus, my true child after a common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.
hmr: Tita, ringna hmunkhata ka nau taktak kuomah: Pa Pathien le Krista Isu ei Sandamtu kuoma inthawka lunginsietna le inremna um raw se.

en: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that were wanting, and appoint elders in every city, as I gave thee charge;
hmr: Hi lei hin Kret thlierkâra khan ka mâksan che a nih: thil sukfel bâkhai chu i sukfel pei theina ding le, thu ka pêk che ang khan khaw tinah upahai i ruotna dingin;

en: if any man is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children that believe, who are not accused of riot or unruly.
hmr: tukhawm, sawisêlbo, nuhmei pakhat nei, nauhai Pathien thu awi, inhawi chên taluona kawnga sawisêl hlaw naw, dân naw anga um naw, an ni ta phawt chun.

en: For the bishop must be blameless, as God’s steward; not self-willed, not soon angry, no brawler, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre;
hmr: Kohran hotu chu Pathien sum enkawltu a ni leiin sawisêlbo a ni ding a nih; mi kâwmaw, lunginrawm, uoin inrui hmang, mi vaw hmang, hlêpna inthieng nawa mi duâm a ni ding a ni nawh.

en: but given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober-minded, just, holy, self-controlled;
hmr: Mi lâwm dân thiem, a ṭha tieng dit, lungril indiktak, mi fel, mi inthieng, insûm thei mi a ni lem ding a nih.

en: holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able both to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict the gainsayers.
hmr: Inchûktirna indik tak kawnga chun mi ân fui theina ding le, sêltuhai chu thiemnaw ân changtir theina dingin inchûktirna ang pei thu ringum chu pawm tlat mi a ni bawk ding a nih.

en: For there are many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision,
hmr: Dân ang nawa um, thu hril mei meihai le hlêmtuhai tamtak an um sih a, sertanhai laia mi an ni deu tak.

en: whose mouths must be stopped; men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre’s sake.
hmr: Chuonghai bau chu huppêk ding a nih, hlêpna inthieng naw dit leia thu inchûktir naw ding inchûk- tirin, mihai a sûng sûngin an chawk khawhlo hlak sih a.

en: One of themselves, a prophet of their own, said, Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, idle gluttons.
hmr: Anni laia mi an zâwlnei pakhat ngeiin, “Kret thlierkâra mihai chu khêlhlip dâm, sahrâng suol dâm, thabo buhehai an ni rawp hlak,” tiin a hril kha.

en: This testimony is true. For which cause reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
hmr: Chu thu inhriettir chu ân dik a nih. Chuleiin, ringnaa chun an indik theina dingin natakin kâwk rawh.

en: not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.
hmr: Judahai tienami thu le, thutak nghatsantuhai thupêkhai chu an ngaisak nawna dingin.

en: To the pure all things are pure: but to them that are defiled and unbelieving nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.
hmr: Mi inthienghai ta ding chun ieng- kim ân thieng hlak; nisienlakhawm, mi inthieng naw le ring nawhai ta ding chun iengkhawm ân thieng hrim a um ngai nawh, an lungril le an sie le ṭha hrietna hrim khawm ân thieng ta nawh.

en: They profess that they know God; but by their works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
hmr: “Pathien kan hriet,” tiin an ṭhang hlak a; nisienlakhawm, tirdak- um dâm, thu awi naw dâm, thil ṭha tinrêng thaw kawnga Pathien dit naw zâwnghai an nih, an thilthawin an inphatsan hlak sih a.
